content: Act as a helpful AI assistant

In Julia, Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the implementation of the add_yearmonth() function based on your input:
```julia
using Dates # To use Date types

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)::DataFrame
    df["ym"] = map(d -> d.year * 100 + d.month, df["dt"])
end

# Example usage:
df = DataFrame(dt=Date.(["2023-01-01", "2024-05-06", "2027-09-10"]))
add_yearmonth(df)
```
This function will create a new column in the input data frame called `ym` by extracting the year and month from the date columns, concatenating them together as an integer, and storing it in the new column.
